comments.html:
> Amazon has a real need for smart NICs to support bare-metal server instances

According to teh Internets, Nitro predates .metal instances by ~4 years, having been launched in 2013 to support the C3 instance types.

Apart from the hardware offload/acceleration, there's real value in having an ability to handle network security policy enforcement outside of the VM OS or a hypervisor.
comments.name: Dmitri Kalintsev

comments.html: Why does this article make me think to SRv6 ... I think this is the perfect example where vendors try to push hard for a feature, claiming "a lot of customers ask for it", whereas almost everybody still wonder what business cases it solves.
